revised_title: Investigating Sun's Observed and Computed Right Ascensions
tldr: The author, James South, conducted observations of the Sun's right ascension at the Blackman-street Observatory and found discrepancies between observed and computed values. He describes the seven-feet transit instrument used for the observations and experiments to determine if the discrepancies were due to instrumental derangement. South concludes that the instrument was accurate and the discrepancies may be due to other factors.
